result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio R Gamez

records.addlTxt:
HELD OFF THE RECORD 
Defendant Antonio R Gamez in court.  Attorney Theodore D. Kafkas in court for Antonio R Gamez.  Attorney William Ackell appeared in person for Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense in receipt of some discovery and offer and needs time to review with client.

Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (18 pages) commencing 08-10-22 by IRENE KOENIGS.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge K. Ashley, Br. 19.

Defendant Antonio R Gamez in court with Attorney Theodore D. Kafkas; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer C. Worthington. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Attorney Theodore Kafkas

No driving without a valid license.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.A.C.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Antonio R Gamez in court with attorney Theodore D. Kafkas.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/28/22 @ 2:30p
